Title: Enable Revisions
DescriptionLines: **Document Revisions** are snapshots of a document that are taken over time per document change.
Once created, revisions are immutable and are useful when you need to track document changes.
Document revisions are not enabled by default.
This demo shows how to enable the feature.

Walkthroughs.Title: Create the revisions configuration object
DescriptionLines: * The `RevisionsConfiguration` object specifies the default revision configuration for all the collections in the database,
and for specific revisions configuration per collection.

Walkthroughs.Title: Define default revisions values for all collections
DescriptionLines: * Set `Default` with the default values for _all_ the collections in the database.
Values can be overridden per collection, as shown in the next step.
* _Disabled_ - Enable or disable the revisions feature.
* _PurgeOnDelete_ - Configure deletion of the revisions upon the parent document deletion.
* _MinimumRevisionsToKeep_ - Comfigure number of revisions to keep. Only the latest 5 revision will be kept.
* _MinimumRevisionAgeToKeep_ - Configure the revisions retention time. Revision will not be kept after 14 days.

Walkthroughs.Title: Define specific revisions values per collection
DescriptionLines: * Set `Collections` with revisions values per specific collections.
These values will override the default configuration from the previous step.

Walkthroughs.Title: Set the revisions configuration in the Document Store
DescriptionLines: * Upon enabling the revision feature, a revision will be created for every change made to the document.
